description: Creates a public virtual interface. A virtual interface is the VLAN that transports Direct Connect traffic. A public virtual interface supports sending traffic to public services of Amazon Web Services such as Amazon S3. When creating an IPv6 public virtual interface ( addressFamily is ipv6), leave the customer and amazon address fields blank to use auto-assigned IPv6 space. Custom IPv6 addresses are not supported.

parameters.name: newPublicVirtualInterface
parameters.description: Information about the public virtual interface. The name of the virtual interface assigned by the customer network. The name has a maximum of 100 characters. The following are valid characters: a-z, 0-9 and a hyphen (-). The ID of the VLAN. The autonomous system (AS) number for Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) configuration. The valid values are 1-2147483647. authKey (string) --- The authentication key for BGP configuration. This string has a minimum length of 6 characters and and a maximun lenth of 80 characters. amazonAddress (string) --- The IP address assigned to the Amazon interface. customerAddress (string) --- The IP address assigned to the customer interface. addressFamily (string) --- The address family for the BGP peer. routeFilterPrefixes (list) --- The routes to be advertised to the Amazon Web Services network in this Region. Applies to public virtual interfaces. (dict) --- Information about a route filter prefix that a customer can advertise through Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) over a public virtual interface. cidr (string) --- The CIDR block for the advertised route. Separate multiple routes using commas. An IPv6 CIDR must use /64 or shorter. tags (list) --- The tags associated with the public virtual interface. (dict) --- Information about a tag. The key. value (string) --- The value.

nested_params.name: virtualInterfaceName
nested_params.description: The name of the virtual interface assigned by the customer network. The name has a maximum of 100 characters. The following are valid characters: a-z, 0-9 and a hyphen (-).

nested_params.name: asn
nested_params.description: The autonomous system (AS) number for Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) configuration. The valid values are 1-2147483647.

nested_params.name: authKey
nested_params.description: The authentication key for BGP configuration. This string has a minimum length of 6 characters and and a maximun lenth of 80 characters.

nested_params.name: amazonAddress
nested_params.description: The IP address assigned to the Amazon interface.

nested_params.name: customerAddress
nested_params.description: The IP address assigned to the customer interface.

nested_params.name: addressFamily
nested_params.description: The address family for the BGP peer.

nested_params.name: routeFilterPrefixes
nested_params.description: The routes to be advertised to the Amazon Web Services network in this Region. Applies to public virtual interfaces.

nested_params.name: cidr
nested_params.description: The CIDR block for the advertised route. Separate multiple routes using commas. An IPv6 CIDR must use /64 or shorter.

nested_params.name: tags
nested_params.description: The tags associated with the public virtual interface.

nested_items.name: ownerAccount
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the virtual interface.

nested_items.name: virtualInterfaceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the virtual interface.

nested_items.name: location
nested_items.description: The location of the connection.

nested_items.name: connectionId
nested_items.description: The ID of the connection.

nested_items.name: virtualInterfaceType
nested_items.description: The type of virtual interface. The possible values are private, public and transit.

nested_items.name: virtualInterfaceName
nested_items.description: The name of the virtual interface assigned by the customer network. The name has a maximum of 100 characters. The following are valid characters: a-z, 0-9 and a hyphen (-).

nested_items.name: vlan
nested_items.description: The ID of the VLAN.

nested_items.name: asn
nested_items.description: The autonomous system (AS) number for Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) configuration.

nested_items.name: amazonSideAsn
nested_items.description: The autonomous system number (ASN) for the Amazon side of the connection.

nested_items.name: authKey
nested_items.description: The authentication key for BGP configuration. This string has a minimum length of 6 characters and and a maximun lenth of 80 characters.

nested_items.name: amazonAddress
nested_items.description: The IP address assigned to the Amazon interface.

nested_items.name: customerAddress
nested_items.description: The IP address assigned to the customer interface.

nested_items.name: addressFamily
nested_items.description: The address family for the BGP peer.

nested_items.name: virtualInterfaceState
nested_items.description: The state of the virtual interface. The following are the possible values:

confirming: The creation of the virtual interface is pending confirmation from the virtual interface owner. If the owner of the virtual interface is different from the owner of the connection on which it is provisioned, then the virtual interface will remain in this state until it is confirmed by the virtual interface owner.
verifying: This state only applies to public virtual interfaces. Each public virtual interface needs validation before the virtual interface can be created.
pending: A virtual interface is in this state from the time that it is created until the virtual interface is ready to forward traffic.
available: A virtual interface that is able to forward traffic.
down: A virtual interface that is BGP down.
testing: A virtual interface is in this state immediately after calling  StartBgpFailoverTest and remains in this state during the duration of the test.
deleting: A virtual interface is in this state immediately after calling  DeleteVirtualInterface until it can no longer forward traffic.
deleted: A virtual interface that cannot forward traffic.

rejected: The virtual interface owner has declined creation of the virtual interface. If a virtual interface in the Confirming state is deleted by the virtual interface owner, the virtual interface enters the Rejected state.
unknown: The state of the virtual interface is not available.

nested_items.name: customerRouterConfig
nested_items.description: The customer router configuration.

nested_items.name: mtu
nested_items.description: The maximum transmission unit (MTU), in bytes. The supported values are 1500 and 8500. The default value is 1500

nested_items.name: jumboFrameCapable
nested_items.description: Indicates whether jumbo frames are supported.

nested_items.name: virtualGatewayId
nested_items.description: The ID of the virtual private gateway. Applies only to private virtual interfaces.

nested_items.name: directConnectGatewayId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Direct Connect gateway.

nested_items.name: routeFilterPrefixes
nested_items.description: The routes to be advertised to the Amazon Web Services network in this Region. Applies to public virtual interfaces.

nested_items.name: cidr
nested_items.description: The CIDR block for the advertised route. Separate multiple routes using commas. An IPv6 CIDR must use /64 or shorter.

nested_items.name: bgpPeers
nested_items.description: The BGP peers configured on this virtual interface.

nested_items.name: bgpPeerId
nested_items.description: The ID of the BGP peer.

nested_items.name: asn
nested_items.description: The autonomous system (AS) number for Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) configuration.

nested_items.name: authKey
nested_items.description: The authentication key for BGP configuration. This string has a minimum length of 6 characters and and a maximun lenth of 80 characters.

nested_items.name: addressFamily
nested_items.description: The address family for the BGP peer.

nested_items.name: amazonAddress
nested_items.description: The IP address assigned to the Amazon interface.

nested_items.name: customerAddress
nested_items.description: The IP address assigned to the customer interface.

nested_items.name: bgpPeerState
nested_items.description: The state of the BGP peer. The following are the possible values:
verifying: The BGP peering addresses or ASN require validation before the BGP peer can be created. This state applies only to public virtual interfaces.
pending: The BGP peer is created, and remains in this state until it is ready to be established.
available: The BGP peer is ready to be established.
deleting: The BGP peer is being deleted.
deleted: The BGP peer is deleted and cannot be established.

nested_items.name: bgpStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the BGP peer. The following are the possible values:
up: The BGP peer is established. This state does not indicate the state of the routing function. Ensure that you are receiving routes over the BGP session.
down: The BGP peer is down.
unknown: The BGP peer status is not available.

nested_items.name: awsDeviceV2
nested_items.description: The Direct Connect endpoint that terminates the BGP peer.

nested_items.name: awsLogicalDeviceId
nested_items.description: The Direct Connect endpoint that terminates the logical connection. This device might be different than the device that terminates the physical connection.

nested_items.name: region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region where the virtual interface is located.

nested_items.name: awsDeviceV2
nested_items.description: The Direct Connect endpoint that terminates the physical connection.

nested_items.name: awsLogicalDeviceId
nested_items.description: The Direct Connect endpoint that terminates the logical connection. This device might be different than the device that terminates the physical connection.

nested_items.name: tags
nested_items.description: The tags associated with the virtual interface.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value.

nested_items.name: siteLinkEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether SiteLink is enabled.
